issue.title: #2475 Migrating device registries to new messaging client

body:
An obvious candidate seems to be to factor out the telemetry client into a separate module because the device registry for example uses requires it to publish events. The Command Router, on the other hand, also needs to consume commands and needs to query the registry services but is (obviously) not a protocol adapter. We could therefore simply use a less opinionated name for the *adapter* client module or we could factor out the command and registry clients into dedicated modules as well.

WDYT? @calohmn @fkaltner @kaniyan

issue.title: Move telemetry client classes into separate module
issue.body:
This addresses #2540

The current adapter client module is quite opinionated about its usage
scenario, i.e. it is intended to address requirements of protocol
adapters. However, other services also need to publish events but do not
need to query the registry not do they need to consume commands.

In order to better reflect such cases, the classes for sending Telemetry
and Event messages have been moved into dedicated telemetry,
telemetry-amqp and telemetry-kafka modules.

Subsequent PRs can be used to factor out the registry and C&C clients into
dedicated modules if desirable.

body: I think the main problem was already addressed by bccad71b6737e62d6c6865136b0a413a0abdc4b9 making the reference to ProtocolAdapterProperties obsolete. But the separate modules do also make sense üëç as the naming of the imports still was a bit odd...

@calohmn @kaniyan I do have two more PRs on hold for factoring out the C&C and the Device Registry client(s) into separate modules. FMPOV we should go all the way now and resolve the (still) existing *adapter* client module into dedicated *registry* and *command* client modules as well. WDYT?
@sophokles73 Ok, good. There will probably be a conflict with #2711 - I can adapt that PR after your PR got merged then.

> resolve the (still) existing _adapter_ client module into dedicated _registry_ and _command_ client modules as well.

+1

issue.title: Move registry client classes into separate module
issue.body:
This is step two of #2540

The current adapter client module is quite opinionated about its usage
scenario, i.e. it is intended to address requirements of protocol
adapters. However, other services also need to publish events but do not
need to query the registry not do they need to consume commands.

In order to better reflect such cases, the classes for querying the
registry services have been moved into dedicated registry and
registry-amqp modules.
